segments.text: What was the biggest turing point in your life ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I usee I would say that would be moving out of my parents ’ house for the first time .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Till I moved out of my parents ’ home , I became a lot more independent .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What would you say was the lowest point in your life ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That would definitely be getting a divorce .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: We just weren't right for each other .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: The marriage only lasted about a year .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , I got married to a man that I met shortly after I divorced my first husband .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Do you think you'll ever get a divorce again ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh I hope not , my first marriage was a mistake , but this one isn ’ t .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: How long have you been married ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Do you think you'll still love him when he is old and gray ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I think so , hopefully we ’ ll have a long and a happy life together .
segments.speaker: S2
